Lectures

The lectures will be held in the Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering (AME) building, room 202, on the UA campus. Here are directions.

Evening working sessions

There will be evening working sessions at 7:30 pm on Saturday, Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday evenings. The working sessions will provide students with an opportunity to discuss their projects with the speakers, as well as a chance for everyone to get more details or clarifications from the speakers. Active participation is strongly encouraged. The evening working sessions will take place in Salons B and C at the Sheraton Four Points. (Though the sessions begin at 7:30 pm, the room is reserved from 6:00 pm if you wish to get an early start.)

Evening of Arrival

There will be an informal gathering in Salons B and C of the Sheraton Four Points on Friday, March 14 from 6:00 to 10:00 PM.

Registration

Registration for the conference will take place at the informal gathering at the hotel on Friday evening 6:00 to 10:00 pm and again on campus from 8:00 to 9:00 am Saturday morning outside of AME 202. You can get expense reimbursement forms and pay the registration and banquet fees at these times.

Email

Add 2010.aws@gmail.com to your address book so that important messages will not be misflagged as spam.

Coffee

Coffee and pastries will be available 30 minutes before the lectures start each morning. Coffee and snacks will be available during the breaks.

Banquet

The conference banquet will be on Tuesday, March 16 at the Marriott University Park, 880 E. 2nd St. (not at the Sheraton). The gathering begins at 6:00 (there will be a cash bar) with dinner served at 6:15 pm. The cost is $15 for participants and $40 for guests; signup for the banquet took place in advance of the workshop. A map showing the Marriott is here (at the bottom of the page).

Free Afternoon

The afternoon of Monday, March 15 is free time. An excursion to the Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum is planned. Details about the excursion will be available in the registration packet.
